intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris pontica, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it has been introduced to many other regions. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The fruit is a short, club-shaped silique that contains several seeds.
